result.execSummary:
The defendant Tierra D Oehring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 13-CM-178 and 14-CM-84.  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling.  Obtain GED or HSED.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with co-defendants or anyone involved with illegal drugs.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

$100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. Joint and several with co-defendants.

timeConds.notes:
3 months stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent.  Huber release granted. 30 days to report. 
7/28/14 - Court grants delay in reporting to jail until 8/29/14. DTE
To perform 100 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency. Concurrent with 13-CM-178 & 14-CM-84.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge Ehlers - Oehring, Tierra D..            Sheryl: Remove. Laurie: Call DOC and tell them it's removed. DTE
DOC memo re: upcoming probation review hearing

Probation review hearing on June 15, 2020 at 03:45 pm.  THIS HEARING HAS BEEN SCHEDULED AS A ZOOM HEARING PURSUANT TO DOOR COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT DIRECTIVE FOR REMOTE APPEARANCES.  PUBLIC ACCESS IS AVAILABLE AT WWW.WICOURTS.GOV LIVE STREAM COURTS TAB CLICK INTO DOOR COUNTY BRANCH 1.  PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR HOW TO APPEAR REMOTELY ATTACHED.
and Service of Sara Siefert
Probation review hearing on June 15, 2020 at 03:45 pm.
Subpoena & Proof of Service for Sara Siefert

03:03 PM Defendant Tierra D Oehring in court.  Nicholas Paul Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court.  Court reviews events in file, questions Agent Siefert on payments made by defendant since last hearing.  Agent Siefert indicates defendant has made the $300 as ordered by the court.  Court advises defendant she needs to continue making the $50 per month payments.  Agent Siefert advised that all interstate compact cases in this region are now being transferred to Agent Rebecca Cruz out of Green Bay.  Court advises that If payments are not being made, defendant needs to be in court in person for next hearing.  If payments are being made, Agent Cruz can request hearing be cancelled and another PRH be set further out to ensure payments continue to come in.  Court approves phone appearance for Agent Cruz.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
Subpoena & Proof of Service for Sara Siefert

03:13 PM Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions Agent Sara Siefert on how defendant is doing on probation. Agent Siefert indicates the last payment they received from defendant was $100 on 5/02/19.  Defendant indicates she lost her job, explains what's going on in her life since last review hearing.  Court sets another probation review hearing.  Defendant needs to be in court in person if she hasn't paid a minimum $300 toward restitution by 12/09/19.  If payments not made by next hearing, court may be imposing some conditional jail time.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 9, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
and Proof of Service - Sara Siefert

02:58 PM Defendant Tierra D Oehring in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sara Siefert appeared for the Dept. of Corrections. Court reviews previous activity, questions whether Defendant has been paying. Agent advises of payment received today. Court questions Defendant, who will continue to make payments.  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
from DOC requesting Court review probationary term for Ct. 2.     Court amends JOC on Ct. 2 to 2 years probation.  DTE

from DOC Agent Sara Siefert re: missed PRH and payment received from defendant.   Court cancels warrant - sets another probation review hearing for 5/02/19 at 3:00 pm.  Court again stays the 3 months conditional jail time. DTE
Court lifts stay on 3 months conditional jail time.  Huber release granted

03:21 PM Defendant Tierra D Oehring not in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court.  Court reviews events in file, indicates he's checked with JA Ripp and defendant has not called in for hearing.  Court questions Agent Siefert on whether defendant has been making payments or not.  Agent Siefert indicates defendant made an $80 payment in January, that's it.  State requests court impose some of the stayed jail time.  Court orders bench warrant, lifts stay on remaining 3 months jail time. Huber privileges granted.

03:02 PM Defendant Tierra D Oehring in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions Agent Siefert on where defendant is at in payment of restitution.  Agent Siefert indicates last payment DOC received from defendant was 5/31/18.  Defendant indicates she sent out a $30 payment today, will be sending $200 on Dec. 20, explains why she hasn't been able to make her restitution payments. Court indicates there is some stayed jail time that can be imposed. Court advises defendant that $400 needs be paid by 2/11/19 or stay may be lifted on the conditional jail time.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
Subpoena and Proof of Service for Agent Seifert

Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file. Agent Siefert indicates defendant has made 3 payments, has paid more than ordered by the court. Defendant indicates she's working at Taco Bell. Agent Siefert requests another PRH in 6 months. Court sets hearing, wants to see at least $300 paid by 12/10/18 hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Subpoena for Sara Siefert

Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  Court questions Agent Siefert on how defendant is doing on probation. Agent Siefert indicates defendant has made two $50 payments and one $40 payment. Defendant has new charges pending in Grand Rapids, MI and tested positive for drugs recently. Agent Siefert will remain in contact with Michigan agent as to the outcome of those charges before deciding whether defendant's probation will be revoked. Court schedules another PRH for 6/11/18. Defendant needs to have made another three $50 restitution payments by next hearing or stay may be lifted on conditional jail time.  Probation review hearing scheduled for June 11, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone at 3:24 pm.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recalls case. Defendant apologizes for calling late, was at work. Defendant indicates she is working 2 jobs and making just enough money to pay her bills and her rent.  Defendant doing the best she can trying to keep up with everything. Court schedules another PRH for February 2018, advises defendant she needs to have made at least 3 - $50 per month payments by next hearing or stay may be lifted on the conditional jail time.

Defendant Tierra D Oehring not in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, indicates defendant did call the court at 2:00, was told to call back at 3:00 pm.  Court questions Agent Siefert on whether defendant has made any payments. Agent Siefert indicates DOC has not received any payments from defendant since last hearing. Court lifts stay on imposed jail time, issues bench warrant.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file. Agent Siefert indicates defendant made a $200 payment to the Clerk of Courts in May and not the probation office. Agent Siefert indicates defendant now has the correct address as to where to send future payments. Defendant explains where things are at in her life. Agent Siefert indicates defendant was arrested for OWI in May in the State of Michigan, currently in treatment from that conviction. State requests another probation review hearing. Court sets another PRH, indicates to defendant she needs to continue with her monthly payments. Defendant can appear by phone for next hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tierra D Oehring not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions Agent Siefert on how defendant is doing on probation. Agent Siefert indicates defendant has paid $150 toward restitution. Defendant is work, no drug issues, positive attitude. Because defendant is working, court increases defendants monthly payments to $50, sets another probation review hearing for June to see where defendant is at in paying her financial obligations.  Probation review hearing scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tierra D Oehring appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Sara Siefert appears in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Defendant indicates she's still looking for a job. Agent Siefert indicates defendant hasn't made any payments toward her financial obligations but defendants probation has been extended for 2 years. State would like to see some minimal monthly payments being made. Court advises defendant she needs to start making payments, even if it's only $25 a month. Court sets another probation review hearing to see where defendant is at. By next hearing, defendant should have paid at least $150 toward restitution/financial obligations.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tierra D Oehring not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Sara Siefert present in court.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Agent Siefert indicates defendant was to call in for todays hearing. Defendant appears by phone. Agent Siefert indicates defendant is now living in Saginaw, MI.  Defendant was incarcerated in Michigan since March 2015, release the beginning of December. Defendant has been in contact with Agent Siefert, is looking for a job now that she's out of jail. Court advises defendant to keep Agent Siefert advised of current address and employer. State asks court to set another probation review hearing in 6 - 9 months.  Hearing set.  Defendant can appear by phone for that hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - Defendant requests time served or some time knocked off her sentence. Court denies request. DTE

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tierra D Oehring in court with attorney Eric R Heywood.  Defendant Tierra D Oehring in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin w/in 10 days. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Atty Korb makes sentencing statement. Atty Heyward makes statement, advises they have a joint recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.
